paragraph.paragraph:
The Object Browser allows you to browse the objects available for use in your system. You may only browse the objects of a compiled system that is currently open in Visual Studio .NET. As well as being able to view available objects, the object browser allows you to see the
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlfeature features of each object and the relationships between objects, for example,
/20_Language/10_Eiffel_NET/10_Conventions/index.xmlancestors ancestors . The Object Browser extends the functionality provided by the ../class_view/index.xmlClass View with browsable information for a project's url*references and search capabilities.

hierarchy.xml An Overview of the Object Browser Hierarchy
An overview of the vxurfClassViewWindow 0 Class View window and EiffelEnvision's extensions, agumenting the Visual Studio .NET documentation.

eiffel_clusters.xml Object Browser Eiffel Clusters Node
Documentation on the Object Browser Eiffel Cluster nodes.

references.xml Object Browser References Node
Documentation on the Object Browser References nodes.

assemblies.xml Object Browser Assembly Nodes
Documentation on the Object Browser assembly nodes.

types.xml Object Browser .NET Types Nodes
Documentation on the Object Browser type nodes.

members.xml Object Browser .NET Members Nodes
Documentation on the Object Browser member nodes.

searching.xml Searching in the Object Browser
Information on using the search for "symbols" capabilities found in the Visual Studio .NET vxurfObjectBrowserS 0 Object Browser .
